The first thing that catches your eye about the Mini Focus MF0399 is the sophisticated black face with vibrant red accents. The red-accented subdial and the seconds hand provide an eye-catching pop of color against the black backdrop.  The Tonneau shaped black case is a work of art. The sleek curved lines give the watch a modern, streamlined profile that sits comfortably on the wrist. The black finish plays with the light beautifully and the red-trimmed crown is the perfect accent  The stopwatch functionality is a joy to use, with the pushers providing a crisp, responsive feel and the date window at 4 o'clock is another convenient feature.  This watch is an affordable luxury that punches well above its weight class. It's a true testament to the brand's dedication to crafting stylish, high-performance timepieces. It’s a winner! 👍🏼

评论概述: I found that over 'time' it coudn't keep time
评论详情: >>EDIT:  This is one of those watches that you know isn't perfect but you trust it's going to at least keep time.  Wrong. I found it to be not only the thick, alarm clock but the time was not accurate.  <<This is fairly, nicely thick at 16 mm on the side of the case.  It’s one of the thicker watches I’ve ever seen and heavy for a watch.  First impression was like wearing an alarm clock.  However, it will do for informal wear.The first thing I asked myself when I got it is why is it called a “tonneau” watch.  Come to find out, that’s a French word and means the watch face is shaped like a barrel.  Looking at the face of it, I can see it resembling the profile of a barrel.The watch band is a rubberized-looking silicon and very  rigid.  It’s  unwieldy to strap on because it’s so stiff.  It is a skeleton, kind of, sort of.  You see elements of the movement but I wouldn’t totally classify it as a skeleton watch.  I certainly wouldn’t call it a mechanical skeleton watch since it’s quartz.It does have a luminous dial that if you expose to light, will light up in the dark.  Under normal household lighting, I found it did not light up.  Only after I held it directly above a table lamp for a minute did I see the glowing effect in the dark.It does have some interesting features like a date movement.  Why they chose to attach it in such a way that the numbers are upside down to the hands telling the time is a mystery. They could have just had just as  easily created a small dial with the numbers oriented in the proper direction that would have worked.  It ‘s almost like this was an afterthought.  I actually thought I was wearing the watch upside down until I looked at it closer.I did get it to set the date once but then I had trouble trying to make further adjustments.  It has a date function and another number wheel that I never have figured out. The instructions weren’t of any help on that. Time, date and week?

One of my favourite style of watch is a skeleton; I find it fascinating to see the works... um... working Unfortunately, the best examples of these are mechanical watches that require fairly constant arm movement or watch-winders which, if you're not dedicated, can be at best annoying and at worst undone So, this little beaut is, to my way of thinking, a very nice compromise A"skeletal" design with a convenient movement that reequires NO movement from me

When I first asked my husband to help me review this Men's Mini Focus brand Luxury Skeleton Tonneau Watch, he seemed set on disliking it. He typically doesn't like skeletonized fashion quartz watches that display faux watch parts as design features. He also doesn't like non-sport watches that are too thick to fit under his shirt sleeves. But after trying this watch, my husband was pleasantly surprised by this quartz Mini Focus watch with a skeleton-look dial that measures around a staggering 16mm in case height. Somehow, it all works. This watch with the chunky tonneau case just looks amazing on his wrist.  We received the Black color option (also comes in Red, Gold Black, Gold Blue, and Silver Blue) which has a matte black barrel-shaped case and sturdy silicone watch band with an "MF" signed buckle. The black buckle is glossy rather than matching the matte case finish, but my husband didn't really mind. He said that with this watch, the buckle would be the last thing he's looking at. The case and dial are the stars of this show.  The watch is a basic three hand design (hour, minute, second), but includes a date calendar window at about the 4:30 position. Part of the date wheel is also exposed at the 9 o'clock position, yet the whole dial still looks balanced, helped in no small measure by the two curved lines running the length of the dial that look like the inverse of the Tonneau shaped case. They really draw the eye and hold the entire design together. Additionally, the curved lines, hour markers, and hands are all lumed with glow-in-the-dark luminescent coatings that give the watch a striking appearance in low light. The watch is also easy to set and keeps time well. All in all, this watch was not what my husband had originally anticipated, but far exceeded his expectations.

These watches keep good time and dont EVER pinch wrist hairs.  They are very light weight on your arm... and I have purchased about 7 of these watches to give away as christmas presents.  One of the watches had a SMALL problem that the little stem would not push in and click.  It simply had a little bit of plastic under the stem which was easily picked out and the watch worked perfectly.  My first watch is about 2 years old now, and I had to replace the battery in it.... which was no problem.  I am extremely happy with the watches and can't think of anything to complain about.
